WorkItem.Description:
Setting the style of the DataGridRowHeaders implictly by adding a style with the key typeof(DataGridRowHeader) works as expected, but if I try to set the style using the RowHeaderStyle of the DataGrid, the style will not be applied. This only seems to fail when the style contains a replacement Template. An example of a style which will cause this failure is below:
  <Style x:Key="MyRowHeaderStyle"
		   TargetType="{x:Type WpfToolkit:DataGridRowHeader}">
        <Setter Property="Background" Value="{StaticResource HeaderBackgroundBrush}" />
        <Setter Property="ContextMenu" Value="{StaticResource TextBoxContextMenu}" />
        <Setter Property="BorderBrush" Value="{StaticResource HeaderBorderBrush}" />
        <Setter Property="Template">
            <Setter.Value>
                <ControlTemplate TargetType="{x:Type WpfToolkit:DataGridRowHeader}">
                    <Grid>
                        <Label>Test</Label>
                    </Grid>
                </ControlTemplate>
            </Setter.Value>
        </Setter>
    </Style>
WorkItem.Summary: Setting the RowHeaderStyle of a DataGrid fails is the style contains a ControlTemplate

Comments.Message:
I've also run into this issue. It appears to be related to the fact that the DataGridRowHeader "synchronizes" inheirted properties in OnApplyTemplate. One of the properties it sychronizes is the StyleProperty. If the resulting Style sets the control template, then that "set" is not reflected in the UI (presumably because the current template is currently being applied).

I tried commenting out the sync-ing of the StyleProperty (in SyncProperties) and that fixed the issue. But I'm unsure if that will have other adverse affects.
